page.title: 01ORWELL AND VILLAGES
page.content: The River Orwell flows through the middle of this area. On each side of the river the land is slightly hilly. Most of the land is farmland, with some woodland. On the North side there are the villages of Nacton and Levington. Pin Mill and Chelmondiston are on the South bank. Pin Mill and Levington are closer to the river. Pin Mill is now a yachting centre. Many of the people living in this area are commuters. Although the area has few amenities, it is very beautiful and peaceful and not as flat as much of East Anglia. As an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty,it is rich in wild-life, especially in winter when there are many migrating birds feeding on the river's muddy shores and marshes. There is concern locally that the proposed extension to Felixstowe Docks will have a detrimental effect on the area.
